Articles.Content:
I'm not just talking about mods that add parts. I mean mods that enhance or change gameplay by adding new dynamics and mechanics. RemoteTech 2 for instance. I'm looking to find mods that really immerse you further into the game. Here is a list of mods that I really like so far:

  1. RemoteTech 2
  2. Kethane
  3. KSP Interstellar
  4. SCANsat

These are the mods that get my +1 for innovative design. What do you guys think?

I generally don't use parts packs or gameplay altering mods. My must-haves are:

1. MechJeb

2. Editor Extensions

3. Kerbal Engineer Redux

4. Kerbal Alarm Clock

I do have KW rocketry but only because I'm using real solar system and procedural fairings for the added awesomeness.

1)Real solar system

2)engineer redux

3)Rasterpropmoniter

4)kethane

5)FAR

6)Telemetry

7)Texture replacer

I generally don't use parts packs or gameplay altering mods. My must-haves are:

1. MechJeb

2. Editor Extensions

3. Kerbal Engineer Redux

4. Kerbal Alarm Clock

MechJeb is essential if you start doing some complicated things
The real game-changers for me are remote tech, far, deadly reentry, kethane, and tac life support. Kerbal engineer is a can't-live-without as well. Everything else is just part packs.

I have tons of mods installed and I am only at 2.6 gb. I also get around 40fps so not much lag. I like mods...

Edited February 23, 2014 by tygoo7

My current modlist straight out of GameData: (things in parentheses are descriptors)


000_Toolbar (common toolbar)
ActionGroupManager
ASET (RPM displays, not ALCOR capsule)
CooLRockets (cryo effects, badass)
Diazo (vertical velocity assistant tool)
DMajic Orbital Science
EditorExtensions
EnhancedNavBall
Firespitter (plugin only; dependency for other mods)
FusTek (plugin for service module; not using actual fustek pack until r4.0)
GoodSpeed (fuel pump)
HGR (Home Grown Rockets pack)
Hyomoto (MFD addon for RPM)
JSI (Raster Prop Moniter)
Kalculator
Kermazit (procedural fairings)
KerbCam
KerbonTech (awesome orion-styled command pod)
KerbalJointReinforcement
KerbalTek (hyperedit)
KerbPaint
Klockheed_Martian (plugin for CoolRockets)
KSPX
MobiusRocketWorks
MP_Nazari (HotRockets!)
NavBallDockingAlignmentIndicator
Navyfish (docking alignment indicator)
NearFuture
Notes
NothkeSerCom (6S service tubes)
PorkWorks
PreciseNode
RadialDragChute
RealChute
RLA_Stockalike (probe parts, other goodies)
SHDI (orion style service module)
SelectRoot
SimplePartOrganizer
SpaceplanePlus
Squad (stock parts; duh)
SurfaceLights
SXT
triggerTech (alarm clock, alternate resource panel)
TweakableEverything
UbioWeldingLtd
VesselView
z_thing (some ZZZ models)

Wow, it's grown since the last time I checked it, like a lot.

I didn't realize it was this bad, mainly because half of that is small stuff and plugins that I really never notice but can't live without. Notice i have no large parts packs except NearFuture. NO MEMORY CRASHES. I could probably 86 half of that, and I might.

The real ones I depend on are SelectRoot, EditorExtensions, KSPX, RLA Stockalike, NavyFish, MobiusRocketWorks, and SimplePartOrganizer. I can, theoretically, live with just that. However, I choose not to.
For the time being at least.

Mine:

- 000_Toolbar

- AIES_Aerospace

- aWolf (Perfectrons)

- BoulderCo (Clouds + TextureReducer)

- CrewManifest

- DeadlyReentry

- Dummy_Weights

- FerramAerospaceResearch

- Firespitter (Just the plugin)

- ProcFairings

- KJR

- Kethane

- KWRocketry

- InfernalRobotics

- MechJeb2 (Info)

- RealChute

- RealFuels

- RealSolarSystem (6.4:1 Scale, great fun for upping difficulty from stock)

- StretchySRB

- TextureReplacer

- KerbalAlarmClock

I use

6sSerCom (for storing things, needs firespitter plugin)

Chatterer (don`t want to miss it)

CrewManifest

DockingPortAlignment (very useful)

EditorExtensions

EnhancedNavBall (should be stock imo)

FAR

Firespitter

GoodspeedPump

HooliganLabsAirships

KAS

KerbalAlarmClock (a must-have imo)

KerbalJointReinforcement

Kerbonov

Kethane

PartHighlighter (very useful!)

AlternateResourcePanel (should be stock)

Interstellar

KW with KW-Texture-Pack)

MechJeb

NewSounds

PartGroupsFilter

ProcFairings (i don`t understand, how KW Fairings work )

Protractor

RCSSounds

ShipManifest

SH-MK2Cockpit

SoundtrackEditor

SquadTexturePack

TacFuelBalancer

TALSphericalToroidalPack (looks nice, but nothing used of it so far)

Targetron (VERY useful)

TextureCompressor aggressive

Toolbar

TTMK3Cockpitinternal

VNGParachute with Plugin

For immersion for me the cockpit internals are very important, and i like the sound mods, especially chatterer. I don`t have any ressources left for universe replacer or something like that

Interstellar changes a lot, with interesting things (science, new toys, new goals) to investigate...

TAC Life Support

Ferram Aerospace

Deadly Re-Entry Continued

KW Rocketry (Only the the fairings, all other parts removed)

VOID

Remote Tech 2

Chatterer

Kerbal Beautification/Boulder clouds & cities

Kerbal Alarm Clock

I was shocked to find Chatterer is one of my favorite mods.

KOSMOS

RLA Stockalike

RemoteTech2

KAS

Near-Future Propulsion

Engineer Redux

Docking Camera (Romfarer - Standalone)

B9

KW Rocketry

AIES

FAR

Chatterer

Visual Enhancements (Clouds and City lights)

PartCatalog

RealChutes

Active Texture Management

MSI Infernal Robotics

Module Manager (dll)

Firespitter (dll only)

Blizzy's Toolbar

Improved Spaceplane (Porkjet)

HotRockets

CoolRockets

RollKage

Editor Extensions

Beastly Science (Scoops and Cameras)

Procedural Fairings

SCANsat

And my own parts (Bond Aerospace)

I think that's everything...

Edited February 24, 2014 by NoMrBond
Wow, you guys have a ton of mods, I'll have to check some of them out. Does anyone know if there is a mod that stabilizes framerates or optimizes performance?

When it comes to parts mods...

I basically pull the individual parts I like the look of and want to use out of various add-ons, in many cases changing their original purpose to meet my own needs. It's just a few minutes work with a text editor, once you've experimented a bit and learned how not to break it all

Does anyone know if there is a mod that stabilizes framerates or optimizes performance?

Check out the mods that do texture compression. Might help.

B9 Aerospace

Interstellar

Kethane

Biomass

Mechjeb

SCANsat

Custom Biomes

Community Science Defs

Docking Alignment Indicator

KAS

Remotetech 2

Safechute

Vanguard Parachutes

Rubberband Caterpillar Tracks

RollKage

Spherical Tanks

Modular Tanks

Panda Jager labs

FTmN Atomics

Outrigger Frame

Aviation Lights

Universe Replacer

Aggressive Texture Compressor (Obviously )

I stole parts from:

Near Future Propulsion (I nicked the battery packs and the solar panels)

I think I stole some of the station and rover parts from LLL too.

And of course all of those mods that should honestly be part of the vanilla engine:

Kerbal Alarm Clock

Enhanced Navball

Precise Node

TAC Fuel Balancer

Haystack

RCS Build Aid

I have KW Rocketry, Infernal Robotics, AIES, and several others sitting in my "Mods Archive" folder, but at the moment I don't need them, so I keep them on ice to reduce load times.

Edited February 24, 2014 by JDCollie

KW Rocketry, MechJeb, FAR, Kethane, Crew Manifest, and Near Future Propulsion are my "must-have"s.

I also run B9, KSO, city lights, BioMass, PorkWorks inflatable modules, and Nothke's service tubes.

I'm tempted to try out a few extra planet add-ons, the Interstellar Propulsion Pack, and Cacteye Telescope at some point, the telescope in particular.

Please, I think I use the most mods out of everyone here...

The sad thing is I don't even remember where all those configs come from (Or what most of the mods are anymore)

I have a crappy computer, so i can only use 4 or 5 mods:

Alternis Kerbol

Kerbin Shuttle Orbiter

Mech-Jeb

KSPInterstellar

Protractor
I follow the KISS principles. Kethane, Mechjeb, and Kerbal Alarm Clock are the only mods I use.

Currently, I'm using:

B9 Aerospace

Interstellar

MechJeb (just started using it)

Kethane

Remote Tech 2

ScanSat

LLL

KW Rocketry

AIES Aerospace

Active Texture Management

Final Frontier

Custom Biomes

ACI Cockpits

Boat Parts R4

Procedural Wing

Never heard of Procedural wings. I'll have to check that one out!

Right now it's:

- BoulderCo City Lights/Clouds

- Chatterer

- DeadlyReEntry

- EditorExtensions

- FASA Clamps

- FerramAerospaceResearch

- KerbalJointReinforcement

- Space Shuttle Engines (klockheed martian)

- MechJeb2

- HotRockets!

- SmokeScreen

snip

Fabulous list, John Crichton, I think I may need to take your advice on those of it which I don't have installed.

My must-haves are Kerbal Engineer Redux, Kerbal Alarm Clock, Ferram Aerospace Research, Kerbal Joint Reinforcement, and RemoteTech.
